answer_html: This is where the cumulative probability F(x) changes the most, which means that this is where the probability density function p(x) has its maximal values.
answer_latex:
This is where the cumulative probability
\emph{F(x)} changes the most, which means that this is where the
probability density function \emph{p(x)} has its maximal values.
hints_html: The most probable locations are where the probability density function has its highest values.
hints_latex:
The most probable locations are where the probability density function
has its highest values.
hints_raw: The most probable locations are where the probability density function has its highest values.
question: 3 (b)
sols_html: The spill most likely occurred around the x=25km and/or at the x=75km margin. This is where the cumulative probability F(x) changes the most, which means that this is where the probability density function p(x) has its maximal values.
sols_latex:
The spill most likely occurred around the \emph{x}=25km and/or at the
\emph{x}=75km margin. This is where the cumulative probability
\emph{F(x)} changes the most, which means that this is where the
probability density function \emph{p(x)} has its maximal values.
sols_raw: The spill most likely occurred around the ''x''=25km and/or at the ''x''=75km margin. This is where the cumulative probability ''F(x)'' changes the most, which means that this is where the probability density function ''p(x)'' has its maximal values.
statement_html:
A toxic chemical has been spilled somewhere on a 100 km stretch of highway. The probability that the spill occurred within \(x\) km of the factory is shown in the panel below.

(b) What is/are the most probable location(s) of the spill?
statement_latex:
A toxic chemical has been spilled somewhere on a 100 km stretch of
highway. The probability that the spill occurred within $x$ km of the
factory is shown in the panel below.

\includegraphics[width=0.5\textwidth]{../json_data/MATH103/April_2010/Math_Exam_Resources_Courses_MATH103_April_2010_Question_3_(a)_picture1_top.png}

(b) What is/are the most probable location(s) of the spill?
statement_raw:
A toxic chemical has been spilled somewhere on a 100 km stretch of highway. The probability that the spill occurred within <math>x</math> km of the factory is shown in the panel below.
